#Text=Communicate Effectively With a Teenage Daughter
#Text=Teenage girls have a lot on their minds , and because they 're young , sometimes do n't know how to cope with it all .
#Text=This unfortunate fact can sometimes create tension between them and you .

#Text=But what they may not know is that you are their biggest fan , and this article will tell you how to show them that , and how to develop a comfortable , expressive , loving relationship with her .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Figure out what makes her tick .
#Text=If you know what she likes and dislikes , this will give you common ground .
#Text=Let her know that you love her .
#Text=Do n't be overbearing with this one .
#Text=Maybe you could start small .
#Text=Write a little note and stick it on her mirror .
#Text=Make her cookies .
#Text=Give her a ride somewhere .
#Text=Come to her games or plays .
#Text=Forgive her .
#Text=She is young and is still figuring things out .
#Text=Teach her what she did wrong if she 's made a mistake , but make sure she knows you still love her .
#Text=Let her know that you forgive her and understand that everybody makes mistakes .
#Text=Realize that teenage girls are EXTREMELY emotional .
#Text=This is true for every single teenage girl , whether they show it on the outside or not .
#Text=Just because she yells at you does n't mean she hates you .
#Text=If she does , it 's probably because she has reached the end of her rope and does n't know how to react to her situation .
#Text=Let her cry if she needs to .
#Text=Cry with her , but not too much .
#Text=Rejoice with her .
#Text=Be a strong anchor for her while her emotions are unsettled from hormones , lack of sleep , and too much going on .
#Text=Do things with her .
#Text=Find activities you both enjoy and spend time together .
#Text=Try to see things from her perspective .
#Text=This is a big one .
#Text=Try to see what circumstances and emotions are making her think the ways she does .
#Text=Make sure she knows she can come to you with concerns .
#Text=This is huge .
#Text=When a teenage daughter knows that they can go to their parent(s) with concerns , problems , and joys , it makes communication meaningful and easy .
#Text=Make sure she knows that you are interested in her life and concerns .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=Give her hugs , if she likes it .
#Text=But even if she does n't hug her once in a while .
#Text=Make sure you have a general idea of where she is and what she 's doing .
#Text=Make sure she knows that you are there for more than just telling her what to do .
#Text=Even if it seems like you 're not getting through to her , you really are .
#Text=She is probably too proud or emotional to show it .
#Text=Every once in a while , give her a break with chores and such if she needs it .
#Text=This will help her know that you realize she needs breaks sometimes and that you love her .
#Text=Sometimes , but not always , you need to initiate the conversations .
#Text=There 's a delicate balance of initiating and not initiating conversation which depends on each girl .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do n't scold her in front of her friends or other people she cares about .
#Text=Do n't let her control you .
#Text=That is , make sure that you are still the boss .
#Text=Parents need to teach their children , but do it gently .
#Text=Do n't let her have too much or too little freedom .
#Text=Both of these can have very bad outcomes .
#Text=Do n't tease about boys too much .
#Text=This will push away open conversation about boys and dating .
